Welcome to Moth Ed!

Letʻs label a moth. To label the moth below, drag it into your workspace on the right.

Green tiles are only viewable by you, the teacher. White tiles are what your students see.

You can use these green tiles for

  • guidance for yourself as you present to a class
  • guidance for your students to use — by editing them (drag them across to your workspace) and then publishing your version to the class

You can access any section of the Elementary MothEd curriculum as editable and printable pages to put out for table groups; colorize; etc. Below are two types of additional "teacher only" green tiles. Some are activities you can drag to your right side workspace and publish for your students to access under their "Classwork" tab. Others provide additional resources for hands on activities or learning extensions.

tiles.title: Drag the label to where it belongs on the moth

text:
Groups in CLUE

As your students access CLUE, it places students into groups of 4 automatically. You may want to control this so that groups are composed of students who are already sitting together.

Here’s a controlled approach once everyone is signed in:

  • Have all students close their computers.
  • One group opens their computers to CLUE and joins the same group together.
  • Then the next group does the same, until all your groups have been created in CLUE.

Doing one group at a time controls who is in the CLUE group as only one CLUE group is available at a time on the software, given other laptops are closed/inactive.

In CLUE, everyone works in a group with up to four people.

Groups are important in CLUE. You can learn from table-mates in your group and they can learn from you. Many features of CLUE are designed to help you share information and learn from others in your group and in your class.

You in CLUE

On the right is your workspace. To edit your workspace, you must first add a tile. You get a tile in your workspace by either

  • Dragging a tile from the content (left side) in CLUE into your workspace (right side). Grab the gray triangle in the upper right corner of the tile to move it. (video)
  • Click a button on the central toolbar to open a new tile.

All tiles have a gray triangle with dots up in the upper right corner. To drag a tile, click that triangle and hold it down as you drag into your workspace. A blue line appears where the tile will go when you let go. You can have up to three tiles in a row.

OK, get ready... Here we go!

Discuss Moths with your Group

First, check that all the members of your group have the same group number at the top right of your screen.

Talk about moths with your group. Size, Color, Location, Quantity Found, Weather, Time, A-Ha's

What do you know about moths? Make a sketch by clicking open a Sketch Tile (pencil icon) on the central toolbar or write a list of what your group knows using a Text Tile by clicking on the A icon.

Need more ideas? Watch this Moth video and then discuss some more.

Brainstorm some research questions

What more do you want to know about moths? Take time to think about it and write possible questions in a Text Tile by clicking on the A icon.

When ready, share with the group

Use the group controls so that you can see and share each others' notes. See the image below for how to do that. Watch your teacher model how to turn on the shared button. Watch a video.

Publish (see image above) your work to the class

You can choose one member of your group to publish a summary of the group's work, or you may each publish. When you publish, your workspace will appear under the pink "Class Work" tab (left-hand side of CLUE).

Watch your teacher model this.
